extendedInfo.description: MediaHouse Forum: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/mediahouse-upnp-dlna-appStream music, videos, movies and pictures from PC, NAS or any other device running UPnP/DLNA compliant media server. MediaHouse powers your device i.e. phone, tablets or google TVs with the following capabilities:1. Automatic scan of your home network over Ethernet or Wifi to identify PC, NAS or any other device running UPnP/DLNA media server.2. Shows capabilities of the scanned servers by dividing them into two categories, one from which you can serve content i.e. called Play From and others to which you can play that content i.e. called Play To.3. Use MediaHouse as a browser, player or controller. 4. MediaHouse can control playback of content from a Media Server (called - Play From) to a Media renderer (called - Play To).5. Favorites - Save albums and folders from multiple media servers while browsing6. Play lists - add, delete, rename music play lists. Last played audio tracks are automatically saved.7. Search your big server libraries for albums, artists, video, images by their title 8. Remembers your server selection and uses it in subsequent runs.9. Built in music player with options to seek, pause, play, loop, shuffle and repeat.10. Build in photo viewer with slideshow option.11. Video play in NOT BUILT IN and MediaHouse uses other applications installed on your device. We recommend installing MXPlayer or BSPlayer, Moboplayer etc... They have support for many HD video file formats.12. Support for Landscape mode13. Displays album art and album thumb nails14. Further Tips are available via menu optionTHIS APP DOES NOT CLAIM TO BE DLNA CERTIFIED. Check http://www.dlna.org/consumer-home/look-for-dlna/product-search. However, here is a brief list of what our users are using today with MediaHouse. UPnp/DLNA Servers ------------------1. TwonkyMedia server2. Windows Media Player 123. TVersity4. Serviio5. XBMC6. PS3 Media Server7. MediaMonkey 4.0Â 8. Synology DSM 3.19. MediaTomb10. MiniDLNA11. PURE FlowserverUPnP/DLNA Players ------------------1. Windows Media Player 12 (Has good audio and video support)2. Sony Network Media Players (Good audio but limited support on video playback).3. And of course your phone or tablet works as always.Special Thanks---------------1. This product uses TMDb API but is not endorsed or certified by TMDb. Please consider contributing to the database.OpenSource Projects Used-------------------------1. Cling - http://4thline.org/projects/cling/ - Distributed under LGPL. (Author: Christian Bauer)  2. ActionBarSherlock - http://actionbarsherlock.com/ - Available under apache license. (Author: Jake Wharton) 3. Universal Image loader - https://github.com/nostra13/Android-Universal-Image-Loader. Under BSD3 License. (Copyright (c) 2011-2012, Sergey Tarasevich)Tag: Movie, Music, Video, Photo viewer, network player, media browser,

reviews.title: Love it!!
reviews.comment: Love it. Much better than upnplay. If you need to stream your video look no further.  This plus MX player = win!
reviews.author: Tom Moore

reviews.title: Limited capabilities
reviews.comment: Couldnt see plex media player, but could see vuze (free), but couldnt browse it. Couldnt see the networked Samsung TV. I\'m sure it works great for others with a different setup, but not mine. I\'ll stick with XBMC
reviews.author: Wayne Evans

reviews.title: Perfect solution for me
reviews.comment: Flawless operation on nexus 7 streaming from a USB on my Alcatel ADSL modem/router/dlna server over wifi. It works for any ALL my movies , photos  and music. I have been looking for this player for some time so will buy the paid version to put on a dedicated android device. Well done and thank you.
reviews.author: peter rowed

reviews.title: Works great!
reviews.comment: This is an awesome app, Works on devices that dont have cifs support in its kernel for network folders. Also works on Ouya! Installed this with MX Player and can access my dlna videos from my router and watch all my videos. =)
reviews.author: Mysticales Mystaria

reviews.title: Interesting. How do I play/enqueue all songs from artist or genre?
reviews.comment: Can play music straight from my NAS. Great! But How do I play/enqueue all songs from artist or genre?
reviews.author: Michael BR

reviews.title: So easy to use
reviews.comment: Tried several others and found this so easy to use and works well with my choice of media players and formats and works well over my network.
reviews.author: Daz Widdy

reviews.title: What it says
reviews.comment: I have tried all sorts of upnp controlers. Mediahouse works greatwith cubox v2, philips  HMP 5000 media wifi player and mediatomb to use as a server. Oh and it of caurse works brill on galaxy n8000 which controls the tv,cubox,HMP5000 all through mediahouse, absolutly fantastic
reviews.author: Bob Skinner

reviews.title: Did not work
reviews.comment: No instructions to speak of. Set permissions on my win 7 media player to allow all. This program sees my laptop but when I try to browse it tells me to check permissions.
reviews.author: jayson casavant

reviews.title: BRILLIANT!!
reviews.comment: Just tested this with a Raspberry Pi running minidlna.  First dlna client I downloaded to my SII.  I\'m not going to look for another...  It just WORKS!  Mobile streaming here I come!
reviews.author: Mik Walker

reviews.title: It works
reviews.comment: Not sure what other comments are about saying it is not working for them. I have it running on Samsung S3, S4, Tab, Note, Razr Maxx, Nook, and Transformer.  It plays fine Samsung 6k series, Onkyo, and whatever is in the kids rooms. Running UPNP, NAS, Serviigo, and Plex... If ur having issues then check ur servers and network... It isn\'t the app... Great work I\'ll b going pro soon!!!
reviews.author: Jaffery Hansell

reviews.title: Works great when it can find the source device
reviews.comment: Tried running on both Motorola Zoon and Samsung GS4. Doesn\'t find the source of the video from the device in which the program is running. Sometimes it finds the source sometime it doesn\'t.
reviews.author: Kevin Neumann

reviews.title: Cannot connect over VPN
reviews.comment: Suggests that Servers can be accessed over VPN but is not actually possible. Usless unless you are connected via Wifi (not possible to connect to home network over 3G with VPN for example). Better to use UpnPlay
reviews.author: Shayraz Ikram

reviews.comment: Finds my media tomb just fine and minidlna and plays to my Sony TV a great android app\tA
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Problem with favorites
reviews.comment: Works well except for a bit of a problem with favorites. I\'m using this app to grab all my videos and music from a Western Digital My BookLive Nas upnp drive to play on my Nexus 7 JB 4.3 . I noticed that the favorites get scrambled if the drive happens to reboot. For example saving album A as a fav and a album B as a fav ,after a reboot of the network drive the songs in album A are no longer there and the whole favorites is all mixed up. I\'ve reproduced this bug many times with same result.
reviews.author: Homer Simpson

reviews.title: Perfect :-)
reviews.comment: Works great, I think 99% of people giving it bad reviews just don\'t know how to set up media server, not like it\'s hard though. I set mine up for first time streaming from win8 laptop with ps3 sever software streaming to Sony tv and Xperia phone running on ics, and using this app it was really easy. I also don\'t know how people can complain about something thats free????
reviews.author: Jason kable

reviews.title: Good, not perfect.
reviews.comment: I wish it was possible to stream audio independently from video. This way you could watch a movie on your dlna-enabled TV, but listen to the audio on your headphones.
reviews.author: Pouyan Motamedi

reviews.title: Just what I wanted to replace Samsung Link
reviews.comment: It easily plays media from my Samsung Tablet on my Samsung TV - music, podcasts, videos and side-loaded BBC iplayer downloads all play find, the only app I have found that does that. Much easier to use that the new Samsung Link.  So I\'ll buy the Pro version to say thanks!
reviews.author: Linda Grace

reviews.title: Was good...
reviews.comment: This was a great app, but for some reason it now won\'t see my PS3 Media Server. I have two PC\'s running a media server each, and neither are showing up anymore. I have tried mediahouse, on my Galaxy S3 and my Galaxy tab 2, and neither can see either of the PS3 Media Servers. Not sure if the issue is from a mediahouse update, or a PS3 Media Server or Java one. Please fix, as other than that its a great app.
reviews.author: Jon Anderson

reviews.title: Does not work as I expect.
reviews.comment: It doesn\'t find any device. Waste of time
reviews.author: Rodrigo Mattos

reviews.title: Could be superb
reviews.comment: Very stylish, but spoiled by a few rough edges.  Queue rarely plays smoothly on remote device - stops despite two options (acquire wake lock/handle stop event) being set. Downloads hard to configure - downloaded files keep path (incorrect) and can\'t be found subsequently by other apps. (Or played by this one?)
reviews.author: Tim Banks
